alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:49AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and western Willacy Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 449 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bicentennial Park, or over Edinburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Edinburg, Mission, Elsa, Edcouch, Palmhurst, La Villa, North McAllen, Hargill, Sharyland and Faysville. This includes Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
